forecast.name: Overnight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 5am. Cloudy, with a low around 54. South wind around 13 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain before 11am. Partly sunny. High near 59, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 13 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 31 mph. Chance of precipitation is 80%. New rainfall amounts between a quarter and half of an inch possible.

weather_report:
A damp chill hangs in the air over Downtown San Francisco this early morning, with the remnants of recent rainfall lingering like faded echoes. Before dawn breaks, a slight chance for light rain remains, perhaps an unexpected reminder of winter’s grip. As the clouds gather in a dense shroud, temperatures hover comfortably cool, coaxing the promise of a cozy morning under a soft blanket. The winds sweep in from the south, rustling leaves and stirring the streets at a brisk pace, while quiet whispers of dampness hint at the moisture that kissed the earth earlier.

As the day unfolds, expect the rain to gently persist until nearly noon, leaving a canvas washed clean and reflective. Later, the heavens will play host to fleeting moments of sun, teasing through the clouds, but temperatures will mellow into the comfortable low fifties. The gusts will pick up, sending a sharper chill through the air as you embrace the day. Embracing layers is advisable; a warm coat paired with a scarf will balance the briskness and the dampness, while sturdy footwear will keep your essentials dry. To appreciate this invigorating weather, consider a morning visit to a cozy café, where the aroma of freshly brewed coffee intermingles with the chatter of friendly patrons, or perhaps a leisurely stroll along the waterfront, where you can witness the city shaking off the morning haze, soaking up the unique essence of a San Francisco winter day.
